data.sampled: The classification of the option strategy being implemented in the given trades is a "Long Call, Short Put" strategy, also known as a "Buy-Write" strategy. This strategy involves buying a long-term asset and writing (or selling) a put option against it. In this case, the trader bought a long-term asset (the stock) and sold a put option with a lower strike price ($175) against it, seeking to generate income from the premium received. At the same time, the trader also sold a call option with a higher strike price ($195) against the long asset, seeking to generate additional income from the premium received and limit the potential downside risk if the stock price rises above the call strike price.
